current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Adult Education and Family Literacy Act to reserve funds for American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and Tribal College or University adult education and literacy.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
American
		Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and Tribal College or University adult education and
		literacy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Adult Education and Family Literacy Act/s:211/ss:a/p:3

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall award grants to Tribal Colleges or
		Universities and Native Hawaiian educational organizations—

text.#text: From the amount reserved under

to
		enable the Tribal Colleges or Universities and Native Hawaiian educational
		organizations to develop and implement innovative, effective, and replicable
		programs designed to enhance life skills and transition individuals to
		employability and postsecondary education; and

to provide technical assistance to such colleges, universities, and organizations
		for program administration.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an application at such time and in such manner as the

shall, to the extent practicable, prescribe a
		simplified and streamlined format for such applications that takes into account
		the limited number of colleges, universities, and organizations that are
		eligible for assistance under this section.

text.#text:
To
		be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a Tribal College or
		University or a Native Hawaiian educational organization shall submit to the

Funding shall be awarded under this section to Tribal
		Colleges or Universities or Native Hawaiian educational organizations on a
		competitive basis through grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements of not
		less than 3 years in duration.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may take into account the considerations set forth in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Adult Education and Family Literacy Act/s:231/ss:e

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
make an award to a Tribal College or University or
		Native Hawaiian educational organization that does not include in its
		application a description of a multiyear strategy, including performance
		measures, for increasing the number of adult American Indian, Native Hawaiian,
		or Alaska Natives that attain a secondary school diploma or its recognized
		equivalent.

text.#text: In making awards under this section, the

Activities that may be carried out under a grant
		awarded under this section shall include—

adult education
		and literacy services, including workplace literacy services;

family literacy
		services;

English literacy
		programs, including limited English proficiency programs;

opportunities for
		American Indians, Native Hawaiians, and Alaska Natives to qualify for a
		secondary school diploma, or its recognized equivalent; and

demonstration and
		research projects and professional development activities designed to develop
		and identify the most successful methods and techniques for addressing the
		educational needs of American Indian, Native Hawaiian, and Alaska Native
		adults.

term.#tail:
means a private nonprofit organization
		that—

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Definition of
		Native Hawaiian educational organization

text.#text:
serves the adult
		education and literacy needs and interests of Native Hawaiians;

has
		demonstrated expertise in the education or training of Native Hawaiian
		children, youth, or adults; and

has
		demonstrated expertise in research and program development.
